sect2.title: JMSSender
sect2.para: The JMSSender can be used to send a single JMS message.

Following table describes the JMSSender's properties:
JMSSender properties
Property name Description Required Default value
target JMS destination where the message is send. Yes -
connectionFactory Name of a JMS Connection factory. Yes -
jndiContextFactory Fully qualified name of the JNDI ContextFactory class. Yes -
jndiUrl JNDI location URL. Yes -
jndiSecurityPrincipal JNDI username Yes
jndiSecurityCredentials JNDI password Yes
autoAck Indicates whether the received message will be auto-acknowledged. No true
replyTo The destination where the reply is supposed to be send by server. JMS 'replyTo' header. No ""
persistent Indicated whether the message is to be persisted by JMS provider. No true
transacted Indicated whether the message transport is to be transacted. No false
sendAsObject Indicated whether the message is send as an ObjectMessage instance or a TextMessage (default) instance. No false
username JMS security username. If not provided - JMS transport will be performed unsecured. No ""
password JMS security password. If not provided - JMS transport will be performed unsecured. No ""

simplesect.title: Example of JMSSender configuration
simplesect.programlisting: ... <sender class="JMSSender"> <property name="target" value="jms/queue/YourQueue"/> <property name="receivingTimeout" value="30000"/> <property name="receiveAttempts" value="1"/> <property name="connectionFactory" value="jms/RemoteConnectionFactory"/> <property name="username" value="KingRoland"/> <property name="password" value="12345"/> <!-- JNDI properties--> <property name="jndiContextFactory" value="org.jboss.naming.remote.client.InitialContextFactory"/> <property name="jndiUrl" value="remote://${server.host}:4447"/> <property name="jndiSecurityPrincipal" value="KingRoland"/> <property name="jndiSecurityCredentials" value="12345"/> ... </sender> ...
